title: Leprosy: skin
description: Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin This is a medium power view of a skin section from a patient with BT. It shows brown HLA-DR staining in macrophages and in the epidermis. Immunostain with monoclonal antibody 1B5. This epidermal staining is not normal. HLA-DR expression by the epidermal cells has been switched on by secretion of cytokines from the underlying granulomatous inflammation. Lymphocytes react to the presence of Mycobacterium leprae antigen by secreting interferon-gamma, which up-regulates HLA-DR expression. A similar mechanism may underlie type 1 reaction. See images W003367 and W003367 for H&E stained sections from this patient.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a person with TT. There is a granulomatous infiltrate in the upper dermis, which also involves the epidermis. Note the dense perivascular lymphocytosis. H&E stain.

title: Lung: histoplasmosis
description: Histoplasmosis This is a high power view of the lung lesion shown in image W0047297. It shows several small black-staining yeasts within the necrotic material. These are Histoplasma capsulatum yeasts. Grocott silver stain.

title: Schistosomiasis: urinary bladder
description: Schistosomiasis due to Schistosoma haematobium: histopathology of the urinary bladder This is a medium power view of biopsy tissue taken from a patient 1 month after starting antischistosomal chemotherapy. H&E stain. There are numerous well defined tuberculoid granulomas within the fibrotic suburothelial tissue. Some dead schistosome eggs can also be seen. The inflammation of acute schistosomal cystitis may be granulomatous but is often more diffuse and flooded with eosinophils. After therapy a more granulomatous appearance, such as shown here, is often seen.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This high power view of a skin section shows a diagnostic granulomatous neuritis, diagnostic of BT. Within the epithelioid cell granuloma, there are a few Schwann cells and large numbers of lymphocytes around the granuloma.

Note the lack of defined edges between adjacent epithelioid cells, and their homogeneous, eosinophilic cytoplasm. H&E stain.

title: Amoebiasis: amoebic abscess in liver
description:
Histopathology of the liver: amoebic abscess

This is a low power view of a whole mount section through a chronic amoebic liver abscess. The upper part of the picture shows the necrotic lining of the abscess cavity. 

Between the abscess and the liver parenchyma (bottom of picture) is a band of fibrous tissue due to chronic inflammation. On the left side is a thrombosed blood vessel. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: lymph node
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): lymph node

This is a high power view of a section of lymph node tissue from a case of LL. The paracortex is expanded by many macrophages. Some of the macrophages are foamy, while others contain globi. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a low power view of a histoid leprosy nodule in the skin. There is a discrete inflammatory mass in the dermis. H&E stain.

Histoid leprosy occurs mainly in LL in relapse.

title: Donovanosis (granuloma inguinale): skin lesion
description:
Histopathology of a skin lesion

This is a medium power view of a chronic skin lesion of donovanosis. There is infiltration of macrophages and plasma cells. There is also fibrous scarring in the lower half of the field. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a medium power view of a dermal nerve section, believed to be from a person with TT in reaction. The image shows granulomatous neuritis. There is central fibrinoid (red) and caseous (pink) necrosis. H&E stain

Such necrosis is indicative of a type 1 (reversal) reaction.

See image W0043373 for a low power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with Idt leprosy. Slight inflammation is present around superficial blood vessels, deep dermal sweat glands and a dermal nerve. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a high power view of a dermal nerve from a patient with BT. Within the nerve there is a granulomatous, macrophage infiltrate separating the Schwann cells. Immunostain for S100 (which stains Schwann cells brown).

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a low power view of a histoid nodule in a case of LL. The slide shows a tumour-like mass of macrophages that are stretching and thinning the epidermis. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a high power view of a skin section from a TT patient. It shows a deep nerve bundle surrounded by lymphocytes and epithelioid cells, but there are no giant cells. Note the large numbers of lymphocytes present. H&E stain.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis: liver
description: Visceral leishmaniasis (VL): Liver This is a medium power view of a section from a liver biopsy. The image shows Leishmania amastigotes visible as small dots within Kupffer cells in the sinusoids (arrow). H&E stain. VL is caused by Leishmania species of the L. donovani complex. It is caused by L. donovani and L. infantum in the Old World and by L. chagasi in the New World.

title: Lung: Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia (PCP)
description: Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia (PCP) This low power view shows a lung with chronic PCP. There are solid areas with fibrosis and clumps of degenerate (blue-staining) Pneumocystis carinii. The air spaces are irregularly emphysematous. This can progress to significant cavitation. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction

This high power view of a skin section shows a vertical nerve with classic neuritis. The remaining Schwann cells, plus their axons, are seen as thin, wavy bands. These cells are surrounded by giant cell granulomas and peripheral lymphocytes. H&E stain.

The presence of the numerous, large Langhans' giant cells is evidence of a type 1 reaction, i.e. borderline tuberculoid (BT) upgrading to TT. 

See image W0043361 for a low power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a high power view of a dermal nerve from a patient with BT. There is lymphocytic inflammation around the nerve, with a small epithelioid cell granuloma eroding into it (bottom right). H&E stain.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis: gastrointestinal tract
description:
Visceral leishmaniasis (VL): gastrointestinal tract

This is a low power view of a jejunal section from a small bowel biopsy. The villi are blunted and widened because of structural damage by infiltrating inflammatory cells. Such infection is quite common in VL and may cause malabsorption. H&E stain.

title: Amoebiasis: amoebic abscess in liver
description:
Histopathology of the liver: amoebic abscess

This is a high power view of liver with early abscess formation. The right side of the picture shows necrosis with an inflammatory infiltrate (small, dark cells). The left side shows residual normal liver parenchyma. Several trophozoites are present in the centre of the picture (single, large, pale cells with a dark nucleus). H&E stain.

See images W0044336 and W0044337 for low and medium power views of the same case.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a high power view of a skin section from a patient with TT. The dermal nerve is virtually destroyed, leaving small granulomas. These granulomas contain epithelioid cells, but no giant cells. H&E stain.

See image W0043354 for a low power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This low power view of a skin section shows a florid, pan-dermal, granulomatoid dermatitis. Note the vertically orientated, inflamed nerve at the bottom left of the section (arrow). H&E stain.

See image W0043362 for a view at higher magnification.

title: Schistosomiasis: vulva
description: Schistosomiasis due to Schistosoma haematobium: histopathology of the vulva This is a medium power view of Schistosoma haematobium eggs in the subepithelial tissue of the vulva. H&E stain. There is associated chronic inflammation. These eggs are newly laid and viable.

title: Post kala azar dermal leishmaniasis: skin lesion
description: This is a high power view of a section of skin from a Post kala azar dermal leishmaniasis (PKDL) lesion. The image shows epithelioid cells with some amastigotes. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: local (acute) exacerbation reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): local (acute) exacerbation reaction (LER)

This is a high power view of a section of skin from an LL patient with LER. Many macrophages are seen undergoing apoptosis (individual cell death). H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: local (acute) exacerbation reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): local (acute) exacerbation reaction (LER)

This is a high power view of a skin biopsy from a person with LER. Note the large numbers of globi and solid-staining bacilli in this section. Wade-Fite stain.

title: Leprosy: borderline tuberculoid leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a medium power view of a deep dermal nerve bundle from a case of BT. There is central fibrosis in the nerve bundle. Around the fibrosis there are epithelioid cells. H&E stain. 

See images W0043380 and W0043382 for additional sections from this patient.

title: Lepromatous leprosy (LL): lymph node
description: This is a high power view of a section of lymph node from a patient with LL. It shows numerous, red-stained, acid-fast bacilli (AFB). Wade-Fite stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: lymph node
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): lymph node

This is a medium power view of a section of lymph node from a patient with LL. The paracortex is expanded by abundant, foamy macrophages. H&E stain.

title: Schistosomiasis: vulva
description: Schistosomiasis due to Schistosoma haematobium: histopathology of the vulva This is a low power view of the vulva which shows the surface epithelium to the top left. H&E stain. A pair of adult Schistosoma haematobium lie in a mid-dermis vein (centre), and eggs laid by the female worm can be seen beneath the epithelium. The surrounding tissues are inflamed.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: type 2 ENL reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): type 2 (erythema nodosum leprosum, ENL) leprosy reaction

This is a high power view of a peripheral nerve from a person with type 2 reaction. There are foamy macrophages between Schwann cells. Some of the macrophages have multiple nuclei. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a high power view of a histoid leprosy lesion. There are macrophages under a clear zone of upper dermis (Grenz zone). The macrophages contain many acid-fast bacilli (AFB). Wade-Fite stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: local (acute) exacerbation reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): local (acute) exacerbation reaction (LER)

This is a low power view of a section of skin from an LL patient with LER. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description: Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with TT. It shows the histopathology of a positive lepromin test. Note the central granulomatous area, which indicates good cell-mediated immunity (CMI) to Mycobacterium leprae. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with Idt leprosy. It shows minimal perivascular, and peri-sweat gland, lymphocytic infiltration. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: lymph node
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): lymph node

This is a low power view of a section of lymph node tissue from a patient with LL. There are dark-staining lymphoid follicles, separated by an infiltrate of foamy macrophages. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of a dermal nerve in a skin section from a patient with BT. There is a single acid-fast bacilli (AFB) (arrowed). Wade-Fite stain.

title: Amoebiasis: histopathology of the colon
description:
Histopathology of the colon

This is a medium power view of colonic mucosa. There is oedema of the lamina propria. The goblet cells in the crypts are well preserved and full of mucin. Between the crypts there are many plasma cells and some polymorphs. No amoebae are visible in this field. H&E stain.

This appearance is typical of an early amoebic lesion. Preservation of goblet cells is characteristic (unlike ulcerative colitis, where the goblet cells are destroyed).

title: Cutaneous leishmaniasis (CL): skin lesion
description:
This is a low power view of a skin lesion. The dark-staining granulomas throughout the dermis are a result of perivascular inflammation. H&E stain.

See image W0044362 for a high power view of one of the granulomas.

title: Cutaneous leishmaniasis: skin lesion
description:
Cutaneous leishmaniasis (CL): skin lesion 

This is a medium power view of an ulcerating lesion. The ulcer, at the top of the image, shows cell sloughing. In the centre of the dermis there is an area of necrosis (N) surrounded by lymphoid infiltrate (L). The pale, pink-staining ring of tissue is an area of fibrosis (F). H&E stain.

Necrosis and fibrosis are important for healing. Necrosis is the process of granuloma breakdown by the destruction of infected macrophages. Fibrosis is the deposition of collagen to replace the broken down granuloma tissue. 

See image W0044366 for a higher power view of this lesion.

title: Cutaneous leishmaniasis: skin lesion
description: Cutaneous leishmaniasis (CL): skin lesion This is a medium power view of the ulcerating lesion seen in image W0044363. The image shows an area of tissue outside the granuloma, at the interface between the lymphoid infiltrate (L) and peripheral macrophages (M). The macrophages have a granular appearance because they contain Leishmania sp. amastigotes. Amastigotes were not seen within the macrophages in the central necrotic tissue. H&E stain. A granuloma is a localized inflammatory response. Infected macrophages within the granuloma are eliminated by an effective immune response.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis (VL): spleen
description:
This image shows a low power view of a section of spleen. The lymphoid follicles of the white pulp are atrophied and the intervening red pulp is greatly expanded. H&E stain.

This condition is caused by an accumulation of parasitized macrophages in the veins and sinuses of the red pulp, which blocks the blood vessels and causes tissue necrosis and sequestration of red blood cells. The expansion of the red pulp consequently depletes the white pulp.

title: Leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction

This is a high power view of a skin section from a patient with TT in reaction. There is fibrinoid necrosis (at the bottom right corner), which is a feature of type 1 reaction. H&E stain.

See images W0043369 and W0043370 for low and medium power views of this section.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: local (acute) exacerbation reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): local (acute) exacerbation reaction (LER)

This high power view of a skin section from an LL patient shows LER. There are large numbers of acid-fast bacilli (AFB) within macrophages, and scattered neutrophils. Wade-Fite stain.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis: gastrointestinal tract
description:
Visceral leishmaniasis (VL): gastrointestinal tract

This is a high power view of a section of small intestine. There are numerous macrophages in the lamina propria. 
The granular appearance of the macrophages is due to a dense accumulation of amastigotes. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: type 1 leprosy reaction
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: type 1 leprosy reaction

This is a medium power view of a deep dermal nerve in type 1 reaction. There is an area of nerve necrosis (right side), with adjacent granulomatous inflammation. The area of inflammation consists of epithelioid cells, giant cells and lymphocytes. H&E stain.

See image W0043346 for a lower power view of the section.

title: Leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction

This is a medium power view of a skin section from a patient with BT. Beneath the epidermis the granuloma is diffuse, rather than compact. Note also that there is oedema in the dermis (seen as 'white spaces' that contain fluid). H&E stain. 

This represents a mild type 1(reversal) reaction, with oedema as the main feature.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a low power view of a whole mount section of a histoid leprosy lesion. It shows a discrete, tumour-like nodule in the dermis. H&E stain.

Histoid leprosy is often a manifestation of relapse, following cessation of treatment or resistance to dapsone. With current combination therapy, secondary drug resistance is unlikely to occur.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with early BT. It shows perivascular inflammation in the upper half of the dermis. H&E stain. 

See image W0043376 a high power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: slit-skin smear test
description: Lepromatous leprosy (LL): slit-skin smear (SSS) test This is a high power view of a skin smear from a patient with LL. There are multiple, solid-staining acid-fast bacilli (AFB) within macrophages. Wade-Fite stain. The bacillary index (BI) is 5+.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a high power view of a histoid leprosy lesion in LL. There are many acid-fast bacilli (AFB) in the dermal macrophages. Wade-Fite stain.

title: Leprosy: borderline tuberculoid leprosy, skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This is a medium power view of a sweat gland from a patient with early BT. The sweat gland is disrupted by a granuloma, with asymmetrical lymphocytic infiltration. H&E stain.

See image W0043377 for a low power view of this section.

title: Post kala azar dermal leishmaniasis: skin lesion
description: This is a medium power view of a section of skin from a patient with PKDL. There is an inflammatory infiltrate with epithelioid cells which are not organized into granulomas. H&E stain. Lesions seen in PKDL do not arise from direct inoculation by an infected sand fly but from blood-borne parasites as a consequence of visceral leishmaniasis (VL). The early cutaneous lesions surround a dermal blood vessel, and then enlarge and spread through the dermis.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a high power view of an immunostained histoid leprosy lesion. It shows brown mycobacterial antigen within macrophages. Immunostain against BCG.

title: Cutaneous leishmaniasis (CL): skin lesion
description:
This is a low power view of a section of skin from a CL lesion. The lesion is non-ulcerating but there is marked hyperplasia of the epidermis and a dense dermal inflammation. H&E stain.

For a higher power view of the dermal infiltrate see image W0044370. 

HF indicates a hair follicle.

title: Cutaneous leishmaniasis: skin lesion
description: Cutaneous leishmaniasis (CL): skin lesion This is a medium power view of one of the deep granulomas seen in image W0044361. It shows a central area of epithelioid cells (large cells derived from activated macrophages) surrounded by peripheral lymphocytes and plasma cells (arrow). H&E stain. There are Leishmania sp. amastigotes within the epithelioid cells but these are difficult to see at this magnification.

title: Sickle cell disease: liver
description: In this high power view, there is sequestration of sickled red blood cells. The vascular channels are so distended by this process that the liver tissue is not recognisable. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: borderline tuberculoid leprosy, skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with early BT. The skin appears almost normal, apart from a granulomatous focus around a mid-dermal sweat gland. H&E stain.

See image W0043378 for a medium power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: histopathology of skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of positive lepromin test from a patient with TT. There are a number of granulomas, and a giant cell can be seen within the dermal collagen (at the injection site of the lepromin antigen). H&E stain.

See image W0043334 for a low power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a case of TT. There is a typical, dense lymphocytic infiltration around the vessels and nerves. The deep nerve is particularly prominent at the base of the section.

Note also the involvement of the epidermis. H&E stain.

See image W0043353 for a high power view of the deep nerve.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of a skin section from a person with TT. There is subepidermal granulomatous infiltration extending almost into the basal layers. No giant cells are seen. H&E stain.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis: lymph node
description: Lymph node This image is a medium power view of a section of lymph node. It shows a granuloma with epithelioid cells containing Leishmania sp. amastigotes. To the right, surrounding the epithelioid cells, are plasma cells and lymphocytes. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This image is a high power view of a skin section from a case of TT. There is a dermal lesion with large, pale epithelioid cells (note the prominent nucleoli). Small, dark lymphocytes are also present. H&E stain.

Although nerve elements are not visible, this is probably the site of a neuritis, and the nerve has been destroyed.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis: lymph node
description:
Lymph node

This is a low power view of a section of lymph node. The image shows discrete and confluent granulomas with some necrosis. H&E stain.

In visceral leishmaniasis, parasitized macrophages can infiltrate the sinuses of the lymph nodes and displace the lymphoid tissue. This can lead to a reduction in the formation of red blood cells, white blood cells and platelets.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a high power view of a histoid leprosy lesion. It shows macrophages arranged in a storiform (irregular, whorl-like) pattern. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of a skin section from a case of TT in reaction. It shows fibrinoid necrosis in a granuloma. Note the numerous, multinucleate Langhans' giant cells. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with TT in reaction. It shows pan-dermal, granulomatous inflammation related to neurovascular bundles. The deep nerve at the base of the section is greatly expanded, and has central necrosis. H&E stain.

See image W0043374 for a medium power view of the deep nerve.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of a skin section from a case of Idt leprosy. It shows slight irregularity of the basal layer of the epidermis and minimal lymphocytic infiltration. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This medium power view of a dermal nerve shows a typical neuritis lesion. There is a small, epithelioid cell granuloma, with lymphocytes eroding into the left-hand edge of the nerve (bottom right).

A looser granuloma is located near the artery and vein, towards the top left of the slide. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This high power view of a histoid leprosy lesion shows typical, elongated macrophages. H&E stain.

Histoid leprosy occurs predominantly in LL in relapse.

title: Tuberculous lymphadenitis
description: This is a high power view of a lymph node which shows a tuberculoid granuloma comprised of epithelioid cells and two Langhans' giant cells. There is no evidence of necrosis in this lesion. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: acid-fast bacilli
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of a skin biopsy from an Idt patient. The arrow is pointing to two acid-fast bacilli (AFB) just under the epidermis. Wade-Fite stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: skin

This is a medium power view of a skin section from a patient with Idt leprosy. Lymphocytes can be seen around blood vessels, a hair shaft (middle) and an arrector pili muscle (bottom right). H&E stain.

title: Cryptosporidiosis: rectum
description: Cryptosporidium parvum in the rectum This is a high power view of a rectal biopsy from a patient with HIV-2 infection. Several cryptosporidia are present (very small, round organisms in the lumen of the gland). They appear to lie on the surface of the epithelium, but they are in fact intracellular. H&E stain. The specimen was obtained by rectal biopsy. Biopsy is sometimes needed for the diagnosis of cryptosporidiosis, when parasitological examination is negative or affected organs are difficult to sample (eg. the biliary system).

title: Lepromatous leprosy: type 2 ENL reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): type 2 (erythema nodosum leprosum, ENL) leprosy reaction

This is a high power view of a peripheral nerve from a patient with type 2 leprosy reaction. This slide shows necrotic nerve tissue, infiltrated by polymorphs. H&E stain.

title: Skin: Kaposi's sarcoma
description:
Kaposi's sarcoma (KS)

This is an example of KS of skin. It is a macular lesion, shown at high power. Several jagged, slit-like spaces are dissecting the collagen of the skin. These spaces are formed by endothelial cells and are the earliest histologically identifiable lesion of Kaposi's sarcoma. There is also an associated inflammatory infiltrate. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This low power view of a skin section from a person with TT shows relatively little inflammation. The zone under the epidermis and a mid-dermal nerve are granulomatous (dark staining). H&E stain.

See image W0043355 for a high power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This is a medium power view of a skin biopsy from a patient with TT. There is erosion of the epidermis by granulomas, and a Langhans' giant cell can be seen near the centre of the section. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a medium power view of a dermal nerve from a patient with BT. It shows granulomas (pale zones) separating the nerve fibres and Schwann cells (brown). This indicates intraneural granulomas. Immunostain for S100 (which stains Schwann cells brown).

These intraneural granulomas are specific for leprosy.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with Idt leprosy. There is slight inflammation around the upper dermal vessels and the mid-dermal sweat glands. H&E stain.

title: Amoebiasis: histopathology of the colon
description:
Histopathology of the colon

This is a high power view of the colonic mucosa. There is a line of amoebic trophozoites (stained reddish) near the top of the picture. There is erosion of the surface mucosa and a moderate inflammatory infiltrate in the superficial lamina propria. PAS stain.

title: Brain: toxoplasmosis
description: This high power view of toxoplasma tachyzoites (small arrow) in the brain shows numerous small blue parasites through the parenchyma. They may have emerged from the bradycyst seen towards the right hand side (large arrow). H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: histopathology of skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This image shows a skin section from a person with BT. In this low power microscopic view, several deep dermal nerves are massively enlarged by granulomatous infiltrate. These nerves are surrounded by dense cuffs of dark-staining lymphocytes. H&E stain.

This is the typical appearance of granulomatous inflammation throughout the dermis.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis: lymph node
description: This is a medium power view of a lymph node section. The image shows multiple granulomas and some central necrosis. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: type 2 ENL reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): type 2 (erythema nodosum leprosum, ENL) leprosy reaction

This is a medium power view of a peripheral nerve from a patient with type 2 leprosy reaction. There is necrosis and infiltration by polymorphs, superimposed on collections of foamy macrophages. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: histopathology of skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This is a skin biopsy section from a case of BT. In this low power view there is typical, pan-dermal, granulomatous inflammation. Note that there is no involvement of the epidermis. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy and HIV: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This high power view of a skin section, from an HIV-seropositive adult with TT, shows vasculitis. There is a necrotic arteriole, with a surrounding fibrinoid exudate, in the middle of a granulomatous infiltrate. H&E stain. 

This vasculitis is not a feature of TT, and is probably related to the HIV infection.

See image W0043350 for a low power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin biopsy from a patient with TT. Note the predominantly lymphocytic infiltration (blue staining) around the vessels and deep dermal nerves (in the centre of the section). H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This high power view of a skin section from a case of TT shows a deep nerve. There are lymphocytes surrounding, and partly infiltrating, the nerve. H&E stain.

See image W0043352 for a low power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: borderline tuberculoid leprosy, dermal nerve
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a medium power view of an immunostained deep dermal nerve bundle in BT. It demonstrates the Schwann cells of the nerve, which are too few to be visible on the H&E stain. Immunostain for S100 protein (which stains Schwann cells brown).

See images W0043380 and W0043381 for additional sections from this patient.

title: Cutaneous leishmaniasis: skin lesion
description:
Cutaneous leishmaniasis (CL): skin lesion 

This is a medium power view of the section of skin seen at lower power in image W0044368. There are many plasma cells in the dermis and no amastigotes are seen. This is a healing lesion. H&E stain.

title: Schistosomiasis: histopathology of the lung
description: Schistosomiasis due to Schistosoma mansoni: histopathology of the lung This is a medium power view of a section of lung tissue. It shows an arteriole with an abnormal configuration. The vessel is surrounded by an inflammatory response. H&E stain. The inflammation was caused by the previous impaction of Schistosoma mansoni eggs and granuloma formation. The wall thickness of the arteriole is also increased, which indicates pulmonary hypertension.

title: Leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction

This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with TT in reaction. There is granulomatous inflammation in the middle part of the dermis around nerves and blood vessels. The upper dermis appears pale due to severe oedema, which is a feature of a type 1 reaction. H&E stain. 

See images W0043370 and W0043371 for medium and high power views of this section.

title: Lung: histoplasmosis
description: Histoplasmosis This is low power view (whole mount) of a focal lung lesion, a histoplasmoma. Histoplasmosis is caused by the fungus Histoplasma capsulatum. H&E stain. There is some peripheral residual lung tissue, but most of the tissue is eosinophilic, necrotic and focally calcified material. This is an old, partly healed Histoplasma capsulatum primary infection. The patient was not HIV positive. See image W0047298 for a high power view.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: type 2 ENL reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): type 2 (erythema nodosum leprosum, ENL) leprosy reaction

This is a low power view of a peripheral nerve from a person with a type 2 reaction. The pale zones represent non-necrotic, lepromatous neuritis. The darker areas are acute necrosis and inflammation. H&E stain. 

Type 2 reaction is also known as erythema nodosum leprosum (ENL) reaction.

title: Leprosy: skin biopsy
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of arrector pili muscle in a skin biopsy from a case of Idt leprosy. There are two small clusters of acid-fast bacilli (AFB), stained red. Wade-Fite stain.

title: Amoebiasis: amoebic abscess of liver
description:
Histopathology of the liver: amoebic abscess

This is a low power view of liver tissue. There are several geographical ('jigsaw') areas of necrosis. This is the early stage of abscess formation, before microabscesses become confluent to form a larger abscess. The amoebic trophozoites are visible as small, white dots. H&E stain.

See images W0044337 and W0044338 for medium and high power views of the same case.

title: Schistosomiasis: histopathology of the lung
description: Schistosomiasis due to Schistosoma mansoni: histopathology of the lung This is a medium power view of a pulmonary arteriole that has been disorganized by the previous impaction of Schistosoma mansoni eggs and granuloma formation. The section is stained with an elastic van Giesen stain. This stain colours the elastic lamina black and the muscle wall of the vessel brown. The surrounding fibrous tissue is red. The damage to the arteriole is shown by the discontinuity of the elastic lamina layer. The thickness of the arteriole wall is also increased, which indicates pulmonary hypertension.

title: Leprosy: type 1 leprosy reaction
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: type 1 leprosy reaction

This is a low power view of the deep dermis from a case of BT in reaction. The slide shows severe necrosis of the deep nerve, which passes horizontally at the dermal-subcutis junction (at the bottom of the section). H&E stain.

This necrosis is a feature of a type 1 reaction.

See image W0043347 for a higher power view of the nerve.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: dermal nerve

This high power view of a skin section shows lymphocytic and macrophage inflammation adjacent to a dermal nerve (left). Within the nerve there are two lymphocytes (red arrows) and one acid-fast bacillus (AFB) (black arrow). Wade-Fite stain.

title: Leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a stained dermal nerve in a skin section from a case of BT. This medium power view shows Schwann cells that are diffusely separated by inflammatory infiltrate. Immunostain for S100 (which stains Schwann cells brown).

title: Lepromatous leprosy: type 2 ENL reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): type 2 (erythema nodosum leprosum, ENL) leprosy reaction

This is a high power view of a peripheral nerve from a case of type 2 leprosy reaction. It shows fragmented, acid-fast bacilli (AFB) in the centre of the field. Note also the diffuse, acid-fast debris, which indicates old LL. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: borderline tuberculoid leprosy, skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of a skin section from an early case of BT. There are lymphocytes and some epithelioid cells around the central vessel. H&E stain.

See image W0043375 for a low power view of this section.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This low power view of a skin section shows a typical example of BT. Along neurovascular bundles, at all levels of the skin, there are granulomas with some lymphocytes. The two rounded lesions in the deep dermis are sites of neuritis. H&E stain.

Scanty, intraneural acid-fast bacilli (AFB) were seen on Wade-Fite stain.

title: Cutaneous leishmaniasis: skin lesion
description: This is a medium power view of a section of skin from an early case of CL. The image shows abundant amastigotes within macrophages in the dermis (arrow). This resembles diffuse cutaneous leishmaniasis however, the lesion healed with a granulomatous response. H&E stain.

title: Amoebiasis: amoebic abscess in liver
description:
Histopathology of the liver: amoebic abscess

This is a low power view of liver. The structure in the centre of the picture is a portal tract. The liver tissue is normal on the right side but abnormal on the left, with zones of necrosis. A few trophozoites are present, but they are not clearly seen at this magnification. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a high power view of a histoid leprosy nodule in LL. The lesion closely resembles a dermatofibroma. Note the storiform arrangement of the elongated macrophages, which resemble fibroblasts. H&E stain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy): local (acute) exacerbation reaction
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): local (acute) exacerbation reaction (LER)

This is a medium power view of a skin section from a patient with LER. Note the large numbers of globi. Wade-Fite stain.

title: Schistosomiasis: histopathology of the liver
description: Schistosomiasis due to Schistosoma mansoni: histopathology of the liver This is a medium power view of an active Schistosoma mansoni infection of the liver. There are two granulomas with concentric rings of fibrosis, and the portal tracts are increased in size due to progressive fibrosis. van Gieson stain. This stain colours fibrous connective tissue red.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Indeterminate (Idt) leprosy: skin

This is a medium power view of a skin biopsy section from a case of Idt leprosy. It shows lymphocytes surrounding sweat glands (purple coloured tubules). H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This is a low power view of a skin section from a patient with BT. In this section there is a superficial (subepidermal), perivascular, granulomatous infiltrate. H&E stain.

See images W0043367 for a high power view of this section and W0043368 for an immunostain.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a high power view of a histoid leprosy lesion. The acid-fast bacilli (AFB) are packed within macrophages, like 'sheaves of wheat'. The AFB are solid-staining, which indicates viability. Wade-Fite stain.

Histoid lesions characteristically have very high densities of solid-staining AFB.

title: Amoebiasis: colon
description:
Amoebiasis: histopathology of the colon

This is a low power view of an erosion of colonic mucosa. There is a small superficial defect in the epithelium accompanied by some inflammatory slough and one or two amoebae. This is the earliest lesion, preceding full ulceration. H&E stain.

Note the lack of acute inflammation in the crypts.

title: Leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction

This is a medium power view of a skin section from a patient with TT in reaction. There is upper dermal oedema, which is a feature of type 1 reaction. H&E stain. 

See images W0043369 and W0043371 for low and high power views of this section.

title: Tuberculous lymphadenitis
description: In this medium power view of lymph node, there are several granulomas with early central necrosis. H&E stain.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis): liver
description: Visceral leishmaniasis (VL): liver This image shows a high power view of a section of liver. Leishmania sp. amastigotes are clearly seen within Kupffer cells in the sinusoids. H&E stain. The parasitized Kupffer cells may form small granulomas and block the blood vessels. This may cause tissue necrosis, although damage to the liver cells (hepatocytes) is rare.

title: Tuberculous lymphadenitis
description: This high power view of a lymph node section shows four pink-staining, acid-fast bacilli (AFB). Three of the bacilli are contained within the central Langhans' giant cell, and one is seen in the adjacent macrophage. This is the usual visible density of AFB in a solid lesion in people who are not immunocompromised. Ziehl-Neelsen (ZN) stain.

title: Visceral leishmaniasis: spleen
description:
Visceral leishmaniasis (VL): spleen 

This is a medium power view of a section of spleen. The image shows many plasma cells and parasitized macrophages between the sinusoids. There is also a large number of eosinophils; this is not a typical feature of VL. H&E stain.

title: Leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction
description:
Tuberculoid (TT) leprosy: type 1 (reversal) leprosy reaction

This is a medium power view of a skin section from a patient with TT. It shows granulomatous infiltrate eroding into the epidermis. H&E stain.

This is a feature of type 1 reaction.

title: Leprosy: skin
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: skin

This is a high power view of a skin section from a case of BT. This slide shows superficial granulomas, composed of mature epithelioid cells. H&E stain.

See image W0043366 for a low power view of this section and W0043368 for an immunostained section.

title: Leprosy: borderline tuberculoid leprosy: dermal nerve
description:
Borderline tuberculoid (BT) leprosy: dermal nerve

This is a low power view of a deep dermal nerve bundle from a patient with BT. Note the extensive central fibrosis. H&E stain.

See images W0043381 and W0043382 for additional sections from this patient.

title: Amoebiasis: amoebic abscess in liver
description:
Histopathology of the liver: amoebic abscess

This is a medium power view of liver from a patient with early abscess formation. The upper left of the picture shows an area of necrosis with several amoebic trophozoites (large, pale cells with a single nucleus). The lower and right parts of the picture show a dense inflammatory infiltrate (small, dark cells) and residual hepatocytes (orange-pink).

See images W0044336 and W0044338 for low and high power views of the same case.

title: Schistosomiasis: histopathology of the lung
description: Schistosomiasis due to Schistosoma mansoni: histopathology of the lung This is a medium power view of a Schistosoma mansoni egg trapped in an arteriole. The surrounding lung tissue is inflamed. H&E.

title: Lepromatous leprosy: histoid leprosy
description:
Lepromatous leprosy (LL): histoid leprosy

This is a high power view of a histoid leprosy lesion in LL. It shows the typical, spindle-shaped (elongated) macrophages, which resemble fibroblasts. H&E stain.
